page.title: 02Thorney Landmarks
page.content: In Thorney there are many landmarks. Here are a few.{The Abbey} was built around 900 years ago,though the part left was built in 1638. The vicar we have now leaves Thorney in July 1985 after about 10 years. The {Bedford Hall}is an old water tower, which was renovated, mainly due to the vision of{Mr.Hugh Cave.}The{cottages were built by the{Duke of Bedford}in the 19th century for his workers. The {old windmill}is behind a filling station, to the north of the A47. Another used to stand down Station Road.{The Duke of Bedford School}is located on the south side of the A47, at the Wisbech end of the village. If you wish to find out more turn to the school page.{Medicine Pond}is best known for its ghost story which you can find out about on the ghost pages.
